coredata.dc:title: Role of Academic Libraries in the Achievement of Sustainable Development Goals Case Study: The Mohamed Sekkat University Library

coredata.dc:description: Libraries have a significant impact in the attainment of the SDGs. They are considered worldwide as the most reliable information center that acquires processes, organizes stores, retrieves and disseminates information to users. In this context, the study investigates the role of academic libraries in realizing sustainable development goals, with a specific case study on the Mohamed Sekkat University Library and its contribution to the Global Goals for Sustainable Development by the United Nations (SDGs). The paper centers on how this Moroccan library has incorporated the SDGs into its resources, activities, programs, and projects.

They are considered worldwide as the most reliable information center that acquires processes, organizes stores, retrieves and disseminates information to users. In this context, the study investigates the role of academic libraries in realizing sustainable development goals, with a specific case study on the Mohamed Sekkat University Library and its contribution to the Global Goals for Sustainable Development by the United Nations (SDGs). The paper centers on how this Moroccan library has incorporated the SDGs into its resources, activities, programs, and projects. Â© 2024 The Authors. Published by ELSEVIER B.V. Introduction Today, universities are evaluated on their progress towards the SDGs, using initiatives such as the recently appeared university rankings: notably the Times Higher Education (THE) impact ranking. In which Hassan II University of Casablanca, which is situated in Morocco, has been visible since its creation. But while the roles of researchers and their institutions have always been relatively clear, questions remain about how university libraries can best support the SDGs. First, libraries play a key role in ensuring information accessibility, cultural heritage preservation, research training, and digital inclusion. This is an open access article under the CC BY-NC-ND license (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0) Peer-review under responsibility of the scientific committee of the International Symposium on Green Technologies and Applications International Symposium on Green Technologies and Applications (ISGTAâ€™2023) Role of Academic Libraries in the Achievement of Sustainable Development Goals Case Study: The Mohamed Sekkat University Library Khalid Lahyania*, Ghizlane Diabb, Ghizlane Moukhlissc aENSAM Casablanca, Hassan II University of Casablanca, Morocco bFSJESM, Hassan II University of Casablanca, Morocco cENS Casablanca, Hassan II University of Casablanca, Morocco *khalid.lahyani@gmail.com Abstract Libraries have a significant impact in the attainment of the SDGs. They are considered worldwide as the most reliable information center that acquires processes, organizes stores, retrieves and disseminates information to users. In this context, the study investigates the role of academic libraries in realizing sustainable development goals, with a specific case study on the Mohamed Sekkat University Library and its contribution to the Global Goals for Sustainable Development by the United Nations (SDGs). The paper centers on how this Moroccan library has incorporated the SDGs into its resources, activities, programs, and projects. Â© 2024 The Authors. Published by ELSEVIER B.V. This is an open access article under the CC BY-NC-ND license (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0) Peer-review under responsibility of the scientific committee of the International Symposium on Green Technologies and Applications Keywords: SDGs; Library Services; University library; Sustainable Development Goals 1. Introduction Today, universities are evaluated on their progress towards the SDGs, using initiatives such as the recently appeared university rankings: notably the Times Higher Education (THE) impact ranking. In which Hassan II University of Casablanca, which is situated in Morocco, has been visible since its creation. But while the roles of researchers and their institutions have always been relatively clear, questions remain about how university libraries can best support the SDGs. First, libraries play a key role in ensuring information accessibility, cultural heritage preservation, research training, and digital inclusion. Information and documentation services enhance creativity and il l li t . i i t. r i t r i ( ) . l i r. /l t / r i - t r . li I . . i i rti l r t - - li ( tt :// ti . /li / / . ) r-r i r r i ilit f t i tifi itt f t I t r ti l i r l i li ti a l , II i it f l , b , II i it f l , c l , II i it f l , li .l i il. i i i i i t i t i t tt i t t . i l i t t li l i ti t t t i , i t , t i i i t i ti t . t i t t, t t i ti t t l i li i i li i t i l l t l , it i i t t t i it i it t i ti t t l l l t i l l t t it ti . t t i li i t t i t it , ti iti , , j t . t . li . . i i i l li tt : r ti . r li - - . i i ilit t i ti i itt t t ti l i l i li ti : ; i i ; i it li ; t i l l t l . i , i iti l t t i t t , i i iti ti t tl i it i : t l t i i ti i t i . i i it l , i i it t i , i i l i it ti . t il t l t i i tit ti l l ti l l , ti i t i it li i t t t . i t, li i l l i i i ti i ilit , lt l it ti , t i i , i it l i l i . ti t ti i ti it 2 Author name / Procedia Computer Science 00 (2019) 000â€“000 innovation in universities and the socio-economic world. According to [1] Libraries and education are the panacea for the sustainable development of any nation. Likewise, [2] affirms the pivotal role that libraries play in attaining the Sustainable Development Goals. Moreover, the Sustainable Development Agenda for 2030 by the United Nations delineates 17 goals [3], constituting an inclusive plan addressing peace, prosperity, people, and the planet. These objectives cover economic, environmental, and social aspects [4]. Acknowledging the transformative influence of information and communication technologies (ICT), the International Federation of Library Associations and Institutions (IFLA) firmly asserts that improving access to information and knowledge is instrumental in fostering sustainable development and improving the overall quality of life. Numerous research studies have investigated the perspectives of librarians on the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). For instance, [5] explores the views of South Korean librarians on the SDGs and their strategies for supporting libraries. Authors in [6] analyze the contribution of libraries open to the public in Cameroon to SDG 16, with a focus on peace, justice, and strong institutions. University libraries, as mentioned in [7], have undertaken initiatives to document and plan their contributions to the SDGs, involving the creation of evaluation frameworks and performance metrics. The selection of the 17 Sustainable Development Goals resulted from a global consultation process in 2015, building on the achievements of the objectives set by the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) between 2000 and 2015. These goals encompass a wide range of objectives, including: â€¢ Goal1: Alleviate Poverty â€¢ Goal 2: Eliminate Hunger â€¢ Goal 3 : Promote Good Health & Well-being â€¢ Goal 4 : Ensure Quality Education â€¢ Goal 5 : Attain Gender Equality â€¢ Goal 6 : Puter Water & Sanitation â€¢ Goal 7 : Promote Affordable and Clean Energy â€¢ Goal 8 : Encourage Decent Work and Economic Growth â€¢ Goal 9 : Advancing Industry, Promoting Innovation, and Developing Infrastructure â€¢ Goal 10 : Minimize Disparities â€¢ Goal 11 : Build Sustainable Urban Development â€¢ Goal 12 : Encourage Responsible Consumption â€¢ Goal 13 : Take Action on Climate â€¢ Goal 14 : Preserve Life Below Water â€¢ Goal 15 : Preservation of Terrestrial Ecosystems â€¢ Goal 16 : Promote Peace and Justice â€¢ Goal 17 : Collaborative Efforts for Achieving Objectives 2. Academic libraries' contribution to achieve the SDGs Academic libraries are instrumental in advancing the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Primarily, they participate to education by providing valuable and reliable information resources. Additionally, libraries actively engage in health literacy programs. Notably, the Chinese University of Hong Kong Library has partnered with different university units to design initiatives and programs aimed at promoting good health and wellness [8]. Libraries provide publications of past research results that serve as references for other researchers. The University of Cambridge, in collaboration between the Library and the Office of Research Strategy, implemented an open access policy and practice. This initiative enables the repository to host the research output of university members [9]. Libraries constitute a fundamental component within the economic, social, and educational fabric of nations. They support gender, racial and ethical groups. The Ghana Central Library [10] has introduced a training program aimed at equipping students with fundamental ICT skills, encouraging their regular use of computers in daily tasks. Libraries play a crucial role in addressing 568 Khalid Lahyani et al. / Procedia Computer Science 236 (2024) 566â€“573 Author name / Procedia Computer Science 00 (2019) 000â€“000 3 gender disparities and combatting violence and sexual harassment within the university setting through diverse activities, including conferences, seminars, and awareness campaigns. The study [11] underscored the role of academic libraries in South Africa in supporting SDG 5, emphasizing equality between genders. This is achieved through a range of community engagement (CE) initiatives. Libraries contribute to the preservation of cultural and natural heritage, archiving and protection of knowledge. In 2019, the Australian National University Library accomplished the digitization of all research theses available at ANU from 1954 to 2018 [4]. Libraries provide access to information about sustainable consumption and environmental conservation through a variety of resources, services, and programs. The University in the State of Michigan (MSU) has adopted sustainable practices in its libraries, including initiatives focused on recycling and waste management [12]. Kynea has initiated the Green Library Initiative [13] as part of their commitment to environmental conservation.Libraries offer their communities collections that encompass heritage, law, conflict resolution, and regulations to advocate for peace, equity, and robust institutions. In Cameroon [6], libraries that are open to the public actively participate in promoting peace and justice, occasionally serving as mediators in resolving specific social conflicts. 3. Mohamed Sekkat University Library contribution to the SDGs The Mohamed Sekkat University Library is the result of a partnership between Hassan II University of Casablanca and the Sekkat Foundation. Located in the heart of the university campus, the library is an institution that works for the development of training and research through its documentary and informational offer and its services oriented towards the academic and scientific environment. The library's collections are multidisciplinary and offer a diversity of languages and media, making it a modern library that keeps pace with the developments of the new knowledge society. Books, databases, multimedia and manuscripts are all part of a collection that reflects the image of this distinguished institution. Today, the library serves a student population of nearly 140,587 students from the 18 institutions of the Hassan II University of Casablanca. In addition, the library does not exclude the "general public" category to the delight of book lovers. The diversified and very welcoming spaces of the library favor the organization of scientific events and cultural meetings of great scope. The library's audiences follow this programming on the library's portal, its social networks and its monthly newsletters. 4. Research Questions The main aim of this research is to explore the role of academic libraries in advancing sustainable development goals. The research will address the following questions: â€¢ How do public libraries participate to the achievement of SDGs? â€¢ What specific initiatives has the Mohamed Sekkat University Library undertaken in support of these goals? â€¢ What suggestions or feedback can be provided to enhance the library's role in furthering the SDGs at Mohamed Sekkat University? 5. Methodology This study utilized both an exploratory approach and a case study design, focusing on the Mohamed Sekkat University Library. Content analysis and surveys served as the adopted instruments for data collection. 5.1 Survey Design We administered a questionnaire to university professors, students, and the general public. The survey instrument was designed to elicit responses on how the library at Mohamed Sekkat University contributes to fulfilling the objectives of the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). 5.2 Data Collection Khalid Lahyani et al. / Procedia Computer Science 236 (2024) 566â€“573 569 Author name / Procedia Computer Science 00 (2019) 000â€“000 3 gender disparities and combatting violence and sexual harassment within the university setting through diverse activities, including conferences, seminars, and awareness campaigns. The study [11] underscored the role of academic libraries in South Africa in supporting SDG 5, emphasizing equality between genders. This is achieved through a range of community engagement (CE) initiatives. Libraries contribute to the preservation of cultural and natural heritage, archiving and protection of knowledge. In 2019, the Australian National University Library accomplished the digitization of all research theses available at ANU from 1954 to 2018 [4]. Libraries provide access to information about sustainable consumption and environmental conservation through a variety of resources, services, and programs. The University in the State of Michigan (MSU) has adopted sustainable practices in its libraries, including initiatives focused on recycling and waste management [12]. Kynea has initiated the Green Library Initiative [13] as part of their commitment to environmental conservation.Libraries offer their communities collections that encompass heritage, law, conflict resolution, and regulations to advocate for peace, equity, and robust institutions. In Cameroon [6], libraries that are open to the public actively participate in promoting peace and justice, occasionally serving as mediators in resolving specific social conflicts. 3. Mohamed Sekkat University Library contribution to the SDGs The Mohamed Sekkat University Library is the result of a partnership between Hassan II University of Casablanca and the Sekkat Foundation. Located in the heart of the university campus, the library is an institution that works for the development of training and research through its documentary and informational offer and its services oriented towards the academic and scientific environment. The library's collections are multidisciplinary and offer a diversity of languages and media, making it a modern library that keeps pace with the developments of the new knowledge society. Books, databases, multimedia and manuscripts are all part of a collection that reflects the image of this distinguished institution. Today, the library serves a student population of nearly 140,587 students from the 18 institutions of the Hassan II University of Casablanca. In addition, the library does not exclude the "general public" category to the delight of book lovers. The diversified and very welcoming spaces of the library favor the organization of scientific events and cultural meetings of great scope. The library's audiences follow this programming on the library's portal, its social networks and its monthly newsletters. 4. Research Questions The main aim of this research is to explore the role of academic libraries in advancing sustainable development goals. The research will address the following questions: â€¢ How do public libraries participate to the achievement of SDGs? â€¢ What specific initiatives has the Mohamed Sekkat University Library undertaken in support of these goals? â€¢ What suggestions or feedback can be provided to enhance the library's role in furthering the SDGs at Mohamed Sekkat University? 5. Methodology This study utilized both an exploratory approach and a case study design, focusing on the Mohamed Sekkat University Library. Content analysis and surveys served as the adopted instruments for data collection. 5.1 Survey Design We administered a questionnaire to university professors, students, and the general public. The survey instrument was designed to elicit responses on how the library at Mohamed Sekkat University contributes to fulfilling the objectives of the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). 5.2 Data Collection 4 Author name / Procedia Computer Science 00 (2019) 000â€“000 The survey was distributed electronically to the selected participants. Respondents were provided ample time to complete the questionnaires. 5.3 Data Analysis Collected data underwent analysis to derive quantitative insights from the survey. Descriptive statistics, including frequency distributions and averages, were calculated to summarize the responses. Additionally, qualitative responses underwent thematic analysis to identify recurring themes and patterns within the general public, university teachers' and students' open-ended comments. 6. Finding and discussion 6.1 Survey In this study, 71.1% of respondents are female, while 28.9% are male. Most participants in the study fall within the age range of 18 to 24 years old. Fig. 1. Number of participant in the study Fig. 2. The age of participants The majority of participants (42%) are graduate students, while 36% are undergraduate students. Over than 39% visit Mohamed Sekkat University library weekly. Fig.3. Academic status of participants Fig. 4. Frequency of library visits The most frequently used services or resources at the library are borrowing books and materials, followed by attending workshops or events and accessing online databases. Fig.5. Most frequently used library services 570 Khalid Lahyani et al. / Procedia Computer Science 236 (2024) 566â€“573 Author name / Procedia Computer Science 00 (2019) 000â€“000 5 Over than 50% of respondents are familiar with the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), with 57% being particularly aware of SDG 4, which focuses on Quality Education. Fig.6. Familiarity with the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) Fig.7. The specific Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) in which they are most interested Over than 44% believe that Mohamed Sekkat University Library plays a role in contributing to the objectives of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Fig.8. Does Mohamed Sekkat University Library play a role in advancing the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)? The respondents mentioned some suggestions regarding how Mohamed Sekkat University Library can enhance its role in helping achieve the SDGs, namely: â€¢ Organizing permanent, regular caravans on a national scale and establishing partnerships with organizations with a similar mission. â€¢ Increasing the number of events and activities â€¢ Introducing evening hours for students who prefer to work late at night. Fig.6. Familiarity with the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) Fig.7. The specific Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) in which they are most interested Over than 44% believe that Mohamed Sekkat University Library plays a role in contributing to the objectives of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Fig.8. Does Mohamed Sekkat University Library play a role in advancing the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)? The respondents mentioned some suggestions regarding how Mohamed Sekkat University Library can enhance its role in helping achieve the SDGs, namely: â€¢ Organizing permanent, regular caravans on a national scale and establishing partnerships with organizations with a similar mission. â€¢ Increasing the number of events and activities â€¢ Introducing evening hours for students who prefer to work late at night. 6 Author name / Procedia Computer Science 00 (2019) 000â€“000 6.2 Analysis approach The Mohamed Sekkat University Library has made a substantial effort in promoting the SDGâ€™s in different areas. This study reveals the application of the UN's SDGs at Mohamed Sekkat University Library. The selection of these 16 goals is particularly pertinent to research in higher education and other significant users of the library. The selected SDGs are: â€¢ Goal 1: No Poverty The library provides access to information and skills by providing its users with information media such as multimedia PCs (ICT). Users who do not have the computer tools at home can therefore access information via the Internet on these computers and update their knowledge. They can also benefit from the assistance of a librarian if necessary. In addition, the library ensures that both rich and poor have equal rights to register and access different services, resources and technologies. Â§ Goal 3: Good Health and Well-being Mohamed Sekkat University Library provides its users with access to medical research, which improves public health. Access to public health-related information aids users to become more knowledgeable about their own health and to stay healthy. In addition to a rich collection of health science information, various digital databases are available free of charge through the library network, such as Research4life, ClinicalKey and EBSCO Dentistry. Â§ Goal 4: Quality Education Collections First, the library enables its users to acquire information literacy and learning skills by providing quality service to accompany and support teaching and research activities. Second, the library implements the university's library policy, and serves the information and documentation needs of students, faculty, and researchers. In addition, it supports literacy programs, provides a safe space for learning, and assists researchers in the reuse of research results and data to advance knowledge. In addition, the library enriches the educational experience of students at Hassan II University in Casablanca through extensive services and collections. Over than 1500 students, faculty and staff, and the general public have benefited from the library since October 2022. The multidisciplinary documentary fund of the library in some figures: â€¢ Over 82.000 books in open access â€¢ Over than 30.000 Online journals and more of 96.500 of digital books have been provided. â€¢ Over 3000 Books were loaned since October 2022. The Library facilitates the consultation of its documentary fund via the computerized catalog. The libraryâ€™s OPAC is accessible both from the library and online. It contains the bibliographic references of the entire documentary collection in its various forms (books, periodicals, CD-ROMs and educational software, manuscripts, etc.). The library catalog also includes references from other libraries of the University. A guide to using the catalog in the form of a video is available to users. In the same framework, the library offers extended opening hours until 7 p.m. and on Saturday mornings. The library also welcomes its users during the vacations by giving them access to its spaces conducive to reading, research and concentration. Â§ Goal 5: Gender Equality On the one hand, library supports gender equality by providing equal enrollment, services and accessibility. On the other hand, it promotes the utilization of information and communication technologies. to foster women's empowerment. Â§ Goal 6: Clean Water and Sanitation The library facilitates access to hygiene-related information either through its physical library and digital resources or through awareness-raising activities, campaigns and conferences. Â§ Goal 7: Clean and affordable energy 572 Khalid Lahyani et al. / Procedia Computer Science 236 (2024) 566â€“573 Author name / Procedia Computer Science 00 (2019) 000â€“000 7 Mohamed Sekkat University Library provides open access to ICT, study rooms, group work rooms. Â§ Goal 8: Fair Employment and Advancing Economic Growth The library organizes trainings and workshops for the benefit of youth on soft skills. It also hosts several trainees of different levels and backgrounds each year. (It helps them with online applications, CV writing and job applications). Â§ Goal 9: Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure The Mohamed Sekkat University Library is at the heart of research and university life. It provides Internet access via Wi-Fi, a research infrastructure and a primary tool for increasing connectivity. The library organizes every year a program to support doctoral students in all aspects of research methodology, use of digital databases and researcher visibility. In this sense, the Mohamed Sekkat University Library supports ORCID allowing researchers to identify their studies results through an international registration system. Â§ Goal 10: Reduce Inequity The library provides equitable access to information regardless of ethnicity, religion, disability, immigration status or gender. The library is accessible for people with disabilities, and has designated restrooms and parking spaces for students with limited mobility. It has special computers, a collection of Braille books and audio books for the visually impaired. Â§ Goal 11: Sustainable Cities and Communities The library plays a crucial role in ensuring the safety and preservation of manuscripts; a priceless heritage. A valuable collection of 550 Mohamed Sekkat manuscripts and 1400 old books and lithographs are accessible through the online manuscript catalog. Furthermore, the Mohamed Sekkat Library extends public access to its collections by welcoming visitors. This method improves access to information and collections by incorporating both online and physical exhibitions, along with public lectures. Fig.9. Preservation of manuscripts Moreover, the library provides complimentary online digital literacy training to enhance the knowledge and skills of the community. Collaborating with other research organizations, the library actively seeks funding to improve digital access. Additionally, there is an ongoing digitization project aimed at making all the theses from UH2C available online, thereby increasing the visibility of research conducted by UH2C PhD students. Â§ Goal 12: Responsible consumption The Mohamed Sekkat University Library is a sustainable institution, embracing sustainable practices while offering paperless registration and scanners for reproduction to protect the environment. Â§ Goal 13: Climate Action The Library is taking urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts by organizing theme weeks, seminars, book exhibitions and conferences to raise awareness. Â§ Goal 14: Life underwater The library provides scientific information on preservation and conservation techniques through its library collection, digital resources and the organization of conferences. This contributes to raising awareness about the sustainable utilization of oceans, seas, and marine resources in the context of sustainable development. Â§ Goal 15: Life on Earth 8 Author name / Procedia Computer Science 00 (2019) 000â€“000 The library engages in the safeguarding of terrestrial ecosystems, promoting awareness of their sustainable utilization, and advocating for the sustainable management of forests. It also addresses issues such as combating desertification, reversing land degradation processes, and preventing biodiversity loss by organizing seminars and conferences. Â§ Goal 16: Peace, justice and strong institutions The library has the skills and resources to help people transmit, organize, structure and effectively use information for development. Thus, library provides free Internet access to its users to ensure access to information and protection of freedoms. Â§ Goal 17: Partnering for the Goals The Mohamed Sekkat University Library partners with several student clubs and associations to carry out concrete projects related to the SDGs. 7. Conclusion The Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) established by the United Nations provide a new framework for assessing the role of libraries. In this context, this study analyzes the nature of the main activities of academic libraries in light of the SDG methodology by identifying the different services provided including access to collections, exhibitions and public events. Academic libraries contribute significantly to sustainability through various avenues such as digital initiatives, resource management, and technological innovations. Digital initiatives, including the digitization of resources and the implementation of online platforms, reduce the need for physical materials, ultimately minimizing the library's environmental footprint. Efficient resource management practices, such as energy-efficient systems and waste reduction measures, further align the library with sustainable principles. The Mohamed Sekkat University Library provides innovative services that assist students, teachers, administrative staff and the general public and itâ€™s a part of the several other university libraries that contribute to achieve the sustainable development goals. Inf. Sci., doi: 10.1177/09610006221127023. [12] E. D. Mifsud, C. Shiel, et R. Pretorius, Ã‰d., in World Sustainability Series. , Cham: Springer International Publishing, 2017, p. 89â€‘100. doi: 10.1007/978-3-319-47895-1_6. [13] A. Mwanzu, E. Bosire-Ogechi, et D. Odero, Â« The Emergence of Green Libraries in Kenya: Insights From Academic Libraries Â», The Journal of Academic Librarianship, p. 102601, sept. 2022, doi: 10.1016/j.acalib.2022.102601. Khalid Lahyani et al. / Procedia Computer Science 236 (2024) 566â€“573 573 Author name / Procedia Computer Science 00 (2019) 000â€“000 7 Mohamed Sekkat University Library provides open access to ICT, study rooms, group work rooms. Â§ Goal 8: Fair Employment and Advancing Economic Growth The library organizes trainings and workshops for the benefit of youth on soft skills. It also hosts several trainees of different levels and backgrounds each year. (It helps them with online applications, CV writing and job applications). Â§ Goal 9: Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure The Mohamed Sekkat University Library is at the heart of research and university life. It provides Internet access via Wi-Fi, a research infrastructure and a primary tool for increasing connectivity. The library organizes every year a program to support doctoral students in all aspects of research methodology, use of digital databases and researcher visibility. In this sense, the Mohamed Sekkat University Library supports ORCID allowing researchers to identify their studies results through an international registration system. Â§ Goal 10: Reduce Inequity The library provides equitable access to information regardless of ethnicity, religion, disability, immigration status or gender. The library is accessible for people with disabilities, and has designated restrooms and parking spaces for students with limited mobility. It has special computers, a collection of Braille books and audio books for the visually impaired. Â§ Goal 11: Sustainable Cities and Communities The library plays a crucial role in ensuring the safety and preservation of manuscripts; a priceless heritage. A valuable collection of 550 Mohamed Sekkat manuscripts and 1400 old books and lithographs are accessible through the online manuscript catalog. Furthermore, the Mohamed Sekkat Library extends public access to its collections by welcoming visitors. This method improves access to information and collections by incorporating both online and physical exhibitions, along with public lectures. Fig.9. Preservation of manuscripts Moreover, the library provides complimentary online digital literacy training to enhance the knowledge and skills of the community. Collaborating with other research organizations, the library actively seeks funding to improve digital access. Additionally, there is an ongoing digitization project aimed at making all the theses from UH2C available online, thereby increasing the visibility of research conducted by UH2C PhD students. Â§ Goal 12: Responsible consumption The Mohamed Sekkat University Library is a sustainable institution, embracing sustainable practices while offering paperless registration and scanners for reproduction to protect the environment. Â§ Goal 13: Climate Action The Library is taking urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts by organizing theme weeks, seminars, book exhibitions and conferences to raise awareness. Â§ Goal 14: Life underwater The library provides scientific information on preservation and conservation techniques through its library collection, digital resources and the organization of conferences. This contributes to raising awareness about the sustainable utilization of oceans, seas, and marine resources in the context of sustainable development. Â§ Goal 15: Life on Earth 8 Author name / Procedia Computer Science 00 (2019) 000â€“000 The library engages in the safeguarding of terrestrial ecosystems, promoting awareness of their sustainable utilization, and advocating for the sustainable management of forests. It also addresses issues such as combating desertification, reversing land degradation processes, and preventing biodiversity loss by organizing seminars and conferences. Â§ Goal 16: Peace, justice and strong institutions The library has the skills and resources to help people transmit, organize, structure and effectively use information for development. Thus, library provides free Internet access to its users to ensure access to information and protection of freedoms. Â§ Goal 17: Partnering for the Goals The Mohamed Sekkat University Library partners with several student clubs and associations to carry out concrete projects related to the SDGs. 7. Conclusion The Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) established by the United Nations provide a new framework for assessing the role of libraries. In this context, this study analyzes the nature of the main activities of academic libraries in light of the SDG methodology by identifying the different services provided including access to collections, exhibitions and public events. Academic libraries contribute significantly to sustainability through various avenues such as digital initiatives, resource management, and technological innovations. Digital initiatives, including the digitization of resources and the implementation of online platforms, reduce the need for physical materials, ultimately minimizing the library's environmental footprint. Efficient resource management practices, such as energy-efficient systems and waste reduction measures, further align the library with sustainable principles. The Mohamed Sekkat University Library provides innovative services that assist students, teachers, administrative staff and the general public and itâ€™s a part of the several other university libraries that contribute to achieve the sustainable development goals. head.ce:title: Role of Academic Libraries in the Achievement of Sustainable Development Goals Case Study: The Mohamed Sekkat University Library

ce:abstract-sec.ce:simple-para: Libraries have a significant impact in the attainment of the SDGs. They are considered worldwide as the most reliable information center that acquires processes, organizes stores, retrieves and disseminates information to users. In this context, the study investigates the role of academic libraries in realizing sustainable development goals, with a specific case study on the Mohamed Sekkat University Library and its contribution to the Global Goals for Sustainable Development by the United Nations (SDGs). The paper centers on how this Moroccan library has incorporated the SDGs into its resources, activities, programs, and projects.
